To investigate the problem of the increased average time interval to answer a call, the business analyst should use root cause analysis.

Root cause analysis is a tool used to identify the underlying cause of a problem or issue. It is a structured approach that involves breaking down the problem into smaller components, identifying the potential causes of the problem, and analyzing the relationships between those causes. Root cause analysis can be used to identify the root cause of a wide range of problems, including process issues, quality issues, and performance issues.

In this case, the business analyst should use root cause analysis to investigate the increased average time interval to answer a call. This may involve identifying the potential causes of the problem, such as issues with the call management system, staffing levels, or training, and analyzing the relationships between those causes to identify the root cause.
